title: WHIRLING F3 / KLAASJE FULL STORY
description:
6) hardie confessed, whole story (ruby leader)
7) drama white (ruby suspect)

dialogueTree.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Okay." She puts her coffee mug on..."
dialogueTree.english: "Okay." She puts her coffee mug on the table.
dialogueTree.polish: „No dobrze” – stawia kubek z kawą na stole.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Ну добра" — ставіць кубак з кавай на стол.

links.title: You: ""You said you studied *Oranjese lit..."
links.english: "You said you studied *Oranjese lit*. What is with this fugitive stuff?"
links.polish: „Mówiła pani, że studiowała *litkę oranjeską*. A teraz nagle jest pani ścigana?”
links.belarusian: "Вы казалі, што вывучалі *літку аранжэўскую*. А цяпер вас раптам пераследуюць?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I *did* -- I also had a side job s..."
links.english: "I *did* -- I also had a side job selling insurance that I was really good at. Got picked up by a bank. *Competitive intelligence*, they called it."
links.polish: „Tak *było*. Dorywczo sprzedawałam też ubezpieczenia i byłam w tym naprawdę dobra. Zwerbował mnie bank. *Wywiad firmowy*, tak to nazywali”.
links.belarusian: "Так *было*. Зрэдку я таксама прадавала страхоўкі і займацца гэтым у мяне атрымлівалася сапраўды добра. Мяне завербавалі ў банк. *Кампанійнае інтэрв'ю*, так яны гэта называлі".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""After that I sort of..." She smile..."
links.english: "After that I sort of..." She smiles. "Transitioned out of the whole culture scene."
links.polish: „Po tym tak jakby...” – uśmiecha się. „Wywędrowałam z kręgów kulturalnych”.
links.belarusian: "Пасля гэтага як бы..." — усміхаецца. "Я выехала з культурных кругоў".

links.title: You: ""What did you do to have these *peo..."
links.english: "What did you do to have these *people* after you?"
links.polish: „Co zrobiła pani tym ścigającym panią *ludziom*?”
links.belarusian: "Што пані зрабіла гэтым людзям, якія вас пераследуюць?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""It's not nice -- but it's not ille..."
links.english: "It's not nice -- but it's not illegal, not here in Revachol. Or even in Oranje."
links.polish: „Nic miłego, ale też nic nielegalnego, w każdym razie według prawa Revacholu. Czy nawet Oranje”.
links.belarusian: "Нічога прыемнага, але і нічога незаконнага, у любым выпадку паводле закона Рэвашолю. Ці нават Оранье".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What *exactly* did you do?""
links.english: "What *exactly* did you do?"
links.polish: „Co *właściwie* pani zrobiła?”
links.belarusian: "Што *сапраўды* вы зрабілі?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Industrial espionage. I joined a b..."
links.english: "Industrial espionage. I joined a business collective with the intention of betraying them. I did my job well enough to be asked to do it again."
links.polish: „Szpiegostwo przemysłowe. Dołączyłam do pewnego kolektywu z zamiarem zdradzenia go. Poszło mi na tyle dobrze, że poproszono mnie o powtórzenie tego”.
links.belarusian: "Прамысловы шпіёнат. Я далучылася да пэўнага калектыву з намерам здрадзіць яму. У мяне гэта атрымалася настолькі добра, што мяне папрасілі паўтарыць гэта".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""With a bigger company -- the kind..."
links.english: "With a bigger company -- the kind you really, really don't fuck with. I took their ledgers -- two decades' worth of accounting."
links.polish: „Tym razem w większej firmie – takiej, z którą nie leci się w chuja. Zabrałam ich księgi zawierające dwie dekady rachunkowości”.
links.belarusian: "Гэтым разам у большай кампаніі - такой, з якой не варта жартаваць. Я ўзяла іх кнігі, якія ўтрымліваюць дзве дзесяцігоддзі бухгалтэрыі".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I need the names of the companies..."
links.english: "I need the names of the companies involved. And who hired you." He taps on his notebook.
links.polish: „Potrzebuję nazw tych firm. I informacji o tym, kto panią wynajął” – stwierdza, stukając długopisem w swój notatnik.
links.belarusian: "Мне патрэбны назвы гэтых кампаній. І інфармацыя пра тое, хто вас наняў", — адзначае ён, пастукваючы асадкай па сваім нататніку.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""The job was Loosduin County Saving..."
links.english: "The job was Loosduin County Savings Bank -- they sound small but they're part of the Looskap conglomerate. That was the second job. The first was some printer company. You wouldn't know them."
links.polish: „Chodziło o Bank Oszczędnościowy Hrabstwa Loosduin – nie brzmi to szumnie, ale są częścią konglomeratu Looskap. Ich dotyczyło to drugie zadanie. Pierwsze to była jakaś firma drukarska. Nazwa nic panu nie powie”.
links.belarusian: "Гаворка ішла пра Банк ашчаднасці акругі Лоосдуін — гучыць не вельмі ўражліва, але яны з'яўляюцца часткай канцэрну Looskap. Іх датычыцца другое заданне. Першае было звязана з нейкай друкарскай кампаніяй. Назва вам нічога не скажа".

links.title: Empathy: "But she *really* destroyed them. Sh..."
links.english: But she *really* destroyed them. She still feels it.
links.polish: Ale *naprawdę* ją zniszczyła. Czuje to do dzisiaj.
links.belarusian: Але *сапраўды* яе знішчыла. Адчувае гэта да сённяшняга дня.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""As to who hired me for the job --..."
links.english: "As to who hired me for the job -- I don't know. But *they're* after me too. Along with Looskap, and their friends in the MI." She breathes out, heavily. "Once you're done in the competitive intelligence circuit, you don't have allies. You're radioactive."
links.polish: „Co do mojego pracodawcy, nie wiem, kto mnie do tego zatrudnił. Ale *oni* też mnie szukają. Razem z Looskap i przyjaciółmi z MI” – wypuszcza ciężko powietrze. „Kiedy kończysz z wywiadem firmowym, nie masz sojuszników. Jesteś radioaktywny”.
links.belarusian: "Што тычыцца майго працадаўцы, я не ведаю, хто мяне наняў. Але *яны* таксама мяне шукаюць. Разам з Лускэпа і сябрамі з МІ" – цяжка выдыхае. "Калі ты заканчваеш з карпаратыўнай выведкай, у цябе няма саюзнікаў. Ты радыёактыўны".

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Looskap -- these people engineer fi..."
links.english: Looskap -- these people engineer financial disasters in second world countries. The conglomerate also includes The Bank of Consecration, Eeirberg and the popular Pappa Lollo line of dairy products.
links.polish: Looskap. To ludzie organizujący katastrofy finansowe w krajach drugiego świata. Do konglomeratu należą także Bank Consecration, Eeirberg i popularny producent nabiału Pappa Lollo.
links.belarusian: Looskap. Гэта людзі, якія арганізуюць фінансавыя катастрофы ў краінах другога свету. Да кангламерату таксама належаць Bank Consecration, Eeirberg і папулярны вытворца малочных прадуктаў Pappa Lollo.

links.title: You: ""Pappa Lollo!""
links.english: "Pappa Lollo!"
links.polish: „Pappa Lollo!”
links.belarusian: "Папа Лола!"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yeah. Pappa fucking Lollo wants to..."
links.english: "Yeah. Pappa fucking Lollo wants to kill me." She smiles.
links.polish: „Taaa. Jebany Pappa Lollo chce mnie zabić” – uśmiecha się.
links.belarusian: "Тааа. Чортавы Папа Лола хоча мяне забіць", — усміхаецца.

links.title: You: ""I'm sure there are people who have..."
links.english: "I'm sure there are people who have done much worse than that."
links.polish: „Jestem pewien, że są ludzie, którzy dopuścili się znacznie gorszych rzeczy”.
links.belarusian: "Я ўпэўнены, што ёсць людзі, якія здзейснілі значна горшыя рэчы".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Sure. I'm not a war criminal -- bu..."
links.english: "Sure. I'm not a war criminal -- but it was bad. People lost their jobs. Good people too, not just C-Suite..." She shakes her head at the thought.
links.polish: „No pewnie. Nie jestem zbrodniarką wojenną, ale wesoło nie było. Ludzie stracili posady. W tym porządni ludzie, nie tylko menadżeria...” – kręci głową na myśl o tym.
links.belarusian: "Ну вядома. Я не ваенны злачынец, але весела не было. Людзі страцілі пасады. Сярод іх былі прыстойныя людзі, не толькі мэнэджары..." – яна крутнула галавой пры гэтай думцы.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""A lot of people got hurt," she con..."
links.english: "A lot of people got hurt," she concludes. "But that's just more of my shit you shouldn't have to deal with. You're solving a murder."
links.polish: „Ucierpiało wiele osób” – podsumowuje. „Ale to tylko standardowy punkt w moim gównianym życiorysie, którym nie warto zawracać sobie głowy. Istotne jest morderstwo”.
links.belarusian: "Пацярпела шмат людзей", — падсумоўвае ён. "Але гэта толькі стандартны пункт у маім кепскім жыцці, якім не варта сабе замарочвацца. Важнае — гэта забойства".

links.title: Empathy: "That can wait. Look into her eyes -..."
links.english: That can wait. Look into her eyes -- there's more.
links.polish: To może poczekać. Spójrz jej w oczy – to nie wszystko.
links.belarusian: Гэта можа пачакаць. Паглядзі ёй у вочы – гэта не ўсё.

links.title: You: ""What did you *do*?""
links.english: "What did you *do*?"
links.polish: „Co pani *zrobiła*?”
links.belarusian: "Што вы *зрабілі*?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I..." She looks down, then into yo..."
links.english: "I..." She looks down, then into your eyes. "One of them killed themselves. Because of me."
links.polish: „Ja...” – patrzy ci prosto w oczy. „Jeden z nich się zabił. Przeze mnie”.
links.belarusian: "Я..." — глядзіць табе прама ў вочы. "Адзін з іх забіў сябе. Праз мяне".

links.title: Rhetoric: "She says it quickly. Like she's sai..."
links.english: She says it quickly. Like she's said it a hundred times -- to herself? To get used to the idea?
links.polish: Mówi to szybko. Jakby powtarzała to setki razy. Może do siebie? Żeby oswoić się z tą myślą?
links.belarusian: Яна гэта хутка кажа. Як быццам паўтарала гэта сотні разоў. Можа сабе? Каб прывыкнуць да гэтай думкі?

links.title: You: "Let's not pry. It's not part of thi..."
links.english: Let's not pry. It's not part of this case.
links.polish: Nie bądźmy wścibscy. To nie jest element sprawy.
links.belarusian: Не будзем цікаўнымі. Гэта не з'яўляецца элементам справы.

links.title: Suggestion: "Of course. This case takes preceden..."
links.english: Of course. This case takes precedence.
links.polish: Oczywiście. Sprawa jest ważniejsza.
links.belarusian: Вядома. Справа важнейшая.

links.title: You: ""Serves them right. When I am king,..."
links.english: "Serves them right. When I am king, this Savings Bank will be first against the wall."
links.polish: „I dobrze im tak. Jak zostanę królem, Bank Oszczędnościowy pierwszy pójdzie na stracenie”.
links.belarusian: "I добра ім так. Як стану каралём, Ашчадны банк першым пойдзе на страту".

Alternate1.english: "Serves them right. When I am king, Pappa Lollo will be first against the wall."
Alternate1.polish: „I dobrze im tak. Jak zostanę królem, Pappa Lollo pierwszy pójdzie na stracenie”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "І добра ім так. Калі я стану каралём, Папа Лола першы пойдзе на страту".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""This was not a joke. Real people l..."
links.english: "This was not a joke. Real people lost their jobs. Not just in the C-Suite either -- good people. What I did to get to accounting..." She shakes her head at the thought.
links.polish: „To nie było zabawne. Wiele osób naprawdę straciło przez to posady. I to nie tylko menadżeria. Porządni ludzie. To, co zrobiłam, żeby dostać się do księgowości...” – kręci głową na myśl o tym.
links.belarusian: "Гэта было не смешна. Многія людзі сапраўды страцілі з-за гэтага працы. І не толькі кіраўніцтва. Парадачныя людзі. Што я зрабіла, каб трапіць у бухгалтэрыю..." — яна хістае галавой ад гэтай думкі.

Alternate1.english: "Pappa Lollo is not real. He's a picture on a milk carton. Real people lost their jobs. Not C-Suite either -- good people. What I did to get to accounting..." She shakes her head at the thought, then swallows.
Alternate1.polish: „Pappa Lollo nie istnieje. To tylko obrazek na kartonie mleka. Wiele osób naprawdę straciło przez to posady. I to nie menadżeria, ale porządni ludzie. To, co zrobiłam, żeby dostać się do księgowości...” – kręci głową na myśl o tym, po czym przełyka głośno.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Папа Лола не існуе. Гэта проста малюнак на картоннай каробцы з малаком. Многія людзі сапраўды страцілі з-за гэтага працу. І не менеджмент, а прыстойныя людзі. То, што я зрабіла, каб уладкавацца ў бухгалтэрыю..." — яна калоўна трасе галавой пры гэтай думцы, а затым гучна глытае.

links.title: You: ""You're right. This is bad. You've..."
links.english: "You're right. This is bad. You've destroyed what people have built."
links.polish: „Ma pani rację. To paskudne. Zniszczyła pani coś zbudowanego przez innych ludzi”.
links.belarusian: "Вы маеце рацыю. Гэта агідна. Вы знішчылі нешта, створанае іншымі людзьмі".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I am. I am a destroyer. People los..."
links.english: "I am. I am a destroyer. People lost their jobs -- good people. Not just C-Suite assholes. And the way I got into accounting..." She shakes her head at the thought.
links.polish: „To prawda. Jestem niszczycielką. Stracili przeze mnie pracę porządni ludzie. Nie tylko dupki z menadżerii. Gdyby pan wiedział, jak dostałam się do księgowości...” – kręci głową na myśl o tym.
links.belarusian: "Гэта праўда. Я знішчальніца. З-за мяне страцілі працу прыстойныя людзі. Не толькі дуранькі з мэнэджменту. Калі б вы ведалі, як я трапіла ў бухгалтэрыю..." – яна страсае галавой пры гэтай думцы.

links.title: You: ""That's a lot of shit you've gotten..."
links.english: "That's a lot of shit you've gotten yourself into."
links.polish: „Wpakowała się pani w naprawdę niezłe gówno”.
links.belarusian: "Вы ўлезлі ў сапраўднае лайно".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""It is. Many people lost their jobs..."
links.english: "It is. Many people lost their jobs. Not just C-Suite. Ordinary people. What I did to get to accounting..." She shakes her head at the thought.
links.polish: „Owszem. Wiele osób straciło przez to posady. Nie tylko menadżeria. Zwykli pracownicy. To, co zrobiłam, żeby dostać się do księgowości...” – kręci głową na myśl o tym.
links.belarusian: "Так. Шмат хто страціў з-за гэтага працу. Не толькі менеджэры. Звычайныя работнікі. То, што я зрабіла, каб патрапіць у бухгалтэрыю..." — хістае галавой пры думцы пра гэта.

links.title: You: ""Who did you do this to? And on who..."
links.english: "Who did you do this to? And on whose behalf?"
links.polish: „Komu pani to zrobiła? I w czyim imieniu?”
links.belarusian: "Каму пані гэта зрабіла? І ад чыёй асобы?"

links.title: You: ""What *exactly* did you do?""
links.english: "What *exactly* did you do?"
links.polish: „Co właściwie pani *zrobiła*?”
links.belarusian: "Што ўласна спадарыня *зрабіла*?"

links.title: You: ""Understood.""
links.english: "Understood."
links.polish: „Rozumiem”.
links.belarusian: "Разумею".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She takes a drag, then glances over..."
links.english: She takes a drag, then glances over her shoulder.
links.polish: Zaciąga się, po czym rzuca spojrzenie przez ramię.
links.belarusian: Забірае, потым кідае позірк праз плячо.

links.title: You: ""What happened here -- the night he..."
links.english: "What happened here -- the night he died?"
links.polish: „Co się tutaj stało w nocy, której umarł?”
links.belarusian: "Што тут адбылося ў ноч, калі ён памёр?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""We were there." She points to the..."
links.english: "We were there." She points to the window -- the silhouette of the bed is visible. "Together. In bed, I mean."
links.polish: „Byliśmy tam” – wskazuje na okno, za którym widoczny jest zarys łóżka. „Razem. W łóżku, mam na myśli”.
links.belarusian: "Мы былі там", — паказвае на акно, за якім відаць контуры ложка. "Разам. У ложку, я маю на ўвазе".

links.title: You: ""Tell me *exactly* what happened.""
links.english: "Tell me *exactly* what happened."
links.polish: „Proszę opowiedzieć *dokładnie*, co się wydarzyło”.
links.belarusian: "Калі ласка, раскажыце *докладна*, што адбылося".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Okay..." She takes a deep breath...."
links.english: "Okay..." She takes a deep breath. "He was in a kneeling position, he had just entered me. I was on my back, looking at him. I heard the window behind me shatter and I turned to look -- there was a hole in the glass..."
links.polish: „No dobrze...” – bierze głęboki wdech. „Był w pozycji klęczącej, właśnie we mnie wszedł. Ja leżałam na plecach, patrząc na niego. Wtedy usłyszałam dźwięk rozbijanego szkła za mną. Spojrzałam – w szybie był otwór...”
links.belarusian: "Ну добра..." – робіць глыбокі ўдых. "Ён быў у каленьчастай пазіцыі, толькі што ўвайшоў у мяне. Я ляжала на спіне, глядзела на яго. Тады пачула гук бітага шкла за мной. Паглядзела – у шыбе была дзірка..."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I turned back to him." She breathe..."
links.english: "I turned back to him." She breathes out. A moment's silence. "His eyes were looking through me and his mouth was open, dumb... I could see... I could..."
links.polish: „Odwróciłam się znów w jego stronę” – wzdycha i następuje chwila ciszy. Przerywa ją. „Patrzył na mnie nieobecnym wzrokiem, z otwartymi ustami, tępym wyrazem twarzy... widziałam, że... widziałam...”
links.belarusian: "Я зноў павярнулася ў яго бок", — уздыхае і наступае момант цішыні. Яна перарывае яго. "Ён глядзеў на мяне адсутным позіркам, з адкрытым ротам, тупым выразам твару... я ўбачыла, што... я ўбачыла..."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "A great pain moves through her, a d..."
links.english: A great pain moves through her, a dark and indefinite wave. She continues in spite of it.
links.polish: Zalewa ją wielka, mroczna i niemająca końca fala bólu. Mimo to jednak mówi dalej.
links.belarusian: Яе ахоплівае вялікая, змрочная і бясконцая хваля болю. Тым не менш, яна працягвае гаварыць.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I knew he was dead. Before he fell..."
links.english: "I knew he was dead. Before he fell down on top of me."
links.polish: „Wiedziałam, że nie żyje. Jeszcze zanim na mnie upadł”.
links.belarusian: "Я ведала, што ён мёртвы. Яшчэ да таго, як ён упаў на мяне".

links.title: Empathy: "You were right. He *did* enjoy the..."
links.english: You were right. He *did* enjoy the moment of his death.
links.polish: Miałeś rację. *Rzeczywiście* czuł przyjemność w chwili śmierci.
links.belarusian: Ты меў рацыю. *Сапраўды* адчуваў задавальненне ў момант смерці.

links.title: You: ""I knew he enjoyed the moment he di..."
links.english: "I knew he enjoyed the moment he died. I could see it in him."
links.polish: „Wiedziałem, że czuł przyjemność w chwili śmierci. Widziałem to po nim”.
links.belarusian: "Я ведаў, што ён адчуваў задавальненне ў момант смерці. Я бачыў гэта па ім".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""How?""
links.english: "How?"
links.polish: „Jak?”
links.belarusian: "Як?"

links.title: Drama: "You asked her before if he enjoyed..."
links.english: You asked her before if he enjoyed it! She avoided it. How did I not discern it was a lie?
links.polish: Pytałeś ją wcześniej, czy było mu przyjemnie! Uniknęła odpowiedzi. Jak można było przeoczyć to kłamstwo?
links.belarusian: Ты пытаўся ў яе раней, ці было яму прыемна! Яна ўнікнула адказу. Як можна было не заўважыць гэтую хлусню?

links.title: Volition: "You *know* how."
links.english: You *know* how.
links.polish: *Wiesz* jak.
links.belarusian: *Ведайш* як.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He just had a hunch. Detectives ha..."
links.english: "He just had a hunch. Detectives have those sometimes."
links.polish: „Po prostu miał przeczucie. Detektywi czasem je mają”.
links.belarusian: "Проста меў прадчуванне. Дэтэктывы часам іх маюць".

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "Another hit. The lieutenant looks a..."
links.english: Another hit. The lieutenant looks at you -- in acknowledgement.
links.polish: Kolejne trafienie w dziesiątkę. Porucznik spogląda na ciebie z aprobatą.
links.belarusian: Яшчэ адно трапленне ў дзясятку. Лейтэнант з ухвалай глядзіць на цябе.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "A direct hit. The lieutenant looks..."
links.english: A direct hit. The lieutenant looks at you -- in acknowledgement."
links.polish: Trafienie w dziesiątkę. Porucznik spogląda na ciebie z aprobatą.
links.belarusian: Пападанне ў дзясятку. Паратучык глядзіць на цябе з ухваленнем.

links.title: You: ""Just a hunch -- then what?""
links.english: "Just a hunch -- then what?"
links.polish: „Zwykłe przeczucie. Co się stało potem?”
links.belarusian: "Звычайная прадчуванне. Што здарылася потым?"

links.title: You: ""I could see it in his eyes.""
links.english: "I could see it in his eyes."
links.polish: „Widziałem to w jego oczach”.
links.belarusian: "Я бачыў гэта ў яго вачах".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She blinks. Everything is silent fo..."
links.english: She blinks. Everything is silent for a second.
links.polish: Mruga. Panowanie na chwilę obejmuje cisza.
links.belarusian: Міргае. Панаванне на момант ахоплівае цішыня.

links.title: You: ""So my feeling was right earlier. H..."
links.english: "So my feeling was right earlier. He *was* enjoying the moment of his death."
links.polish: „A więc moje przeczucie wcześniej było słuszne. Moment śmierci *był* dla niego przyjemny”.
links.belarusian: "Такім чынам, маё прадчуванне раней было слушным. Момант смерці *быў* для яго прыемны".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yes, but... How did you know that?""
links.english: "Yes, but... How did you know that?"
links.polish: „Tak, ale... Skąd pan to wiedział?”
links.belarusian: "Так, але... Адкуль вы гэта ведалі?"

links.title: You: ""The occult vision was right. He wa..."
links.english: "The occult vision was right. He was enjoying the moment of his death."
links.polish: „Okultystyczna wizja zdradziła mi prawdę. Moment śmierci był dla niego przyjemny”.
links.belarusian: "Акультнае бачанне паказала мне праўду. Момант смерці быў для яго прыемным".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I don't..." She squints. "How did..."
links.english: "I don't..." She squints. "How did you know that?"
links.polish: „Ale przecież...” – mruży oczy. „Skąd pan to wiedział?”
links.belarusian: "Але ж..." – прыжмурае вочы. "Адкуль вы гэта ведалі?"

links.title: You: "(Better not to mention it.) "Then w..."
links.english: (Better not to mention it.) "Then what happened?"
links.polish: (Lepiej o tym nie wspominać). „Co się stało później?”
links.belarusian: (Лепш не згадваць пра гэта). "Што адбылося потым?"

links.title: You: ""Then what happened?""
links.english: "Then what happened?"
links.polish: „Co się potem stało?”
links.belarusian: "Што адбылося потым?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""He was heavy. I pushed him off and..."
links.english: "He was heavy. I pushed him off and he fell to the floor -- there." She points through the window. "He only had his boots on. I bit the pillow... not to scream, then ran downstairs..." There's a long pause. She just stands there, her arms at her sides.
links.polish: „Ciężki był. Odepchnęłam go i stoczył się na podłogę – tam” – wskazuje miejsce za oknem. „Miał na sobie tylko buty. Zagryzłam poduszkę... żeby nie krzyczeć, a potem zbiegłam do pokoju niżej...” – następuje długa pauza. Twoja rozmówczyni stoi teraz w ciszy z rękami opuszczonymi wzdłuż tułowia.
links.belarusian: "Цяжкі быў. Адштурхнула яго, і ён скочыўся на падлогу – там", – паказвае месца за акном. "На ім толькі боты былі. Загрызла падушку... каб не крычаць, а потым збегла ў пакой ніжэй..." – ідзе доўгая паўза. Твая субяседніца цяпер стаіць у цішыні з апушчанымі ўздоўж цела рукамі.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I waited for the second shot to co..."
links.english: "I waited for the second shot to come -- for me. I thought there would be one. It never came."
links.polish: „Spodziewałam się drugiego strzału. Czekałam, aż mnie dosięgnie. Nie było drugiego”.
links.belarusian: "Я чакала другога стрэлу. Чакала, пакуль ён дасягне мяне. Другога не было."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "She's forgotten about her cigarette..."
links.english: She's forgotten about her cigarette. The butt has burned right down to her fingernails...
links.polish: Zapomniała o papierosie. Żar na niedopałku zaraz dosięgnie jej paznokci...
links.belarusian: Яна забыла пра цыгарэту. Жар на недапалку вось-вось дасягне яе пазногцяў...

links.title: You: ""Your cigarette, miss.""
links.english: "Your cigarette, miss."
links.polish: „Pani papieros”.
links.belarusian: "Пані цыгарэта".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Oh..." She looks at it and quickly..."
links.english: "Oh..." She looks at it and quickly tosses the butt aside.
links.polish: „Och...” – zorientowawszy się, szybko odrzuca niedopałek.
links.belarusian: "Ох..." – зразумела яна, хутка адкідваючы недапалак.

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry this happened to you.""
links.english: "I'm sorry this happened to you."
links.polish: „Przykro mi, że się to pani przydarzyło”.
links.belarusian: "Мне шкада, што з Вамі такое здарылася".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""So am I." She looks down. Her ciga..."
links.english: "So am I." She looks down. Her cigarette has singed her fingers.
links.polish: „Mnie też” – przenosi wzrok na papieros, który właśnie poparzył jej palce.
links.belarusian: "Мяне таксама", – пераносіць погляд на цыгарэту, якая толькі што апякла яе пальцы.

Alternate1.english: "So am I." She immediately proceeds to light another one.
Alternate1.polish: „Mnie też” – od razu przystępuje do zapalenia kolejnego.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Мне таксама" — адразу прыступае да запальвання наступнай.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What time was this? When did it ha..."
links.english: "What time was this? When did it happen -- it would help us if you could be as precise as possible."
links.polish: „Która była godzina? Gdy do tego doszło? Będziemy wdzięczni za jak najprecyzyjniejszą odpowiedź”.
links.belarusian: "Каторы быў час? Калі гэта здарылася? Будзем удзячныя за максімальна дакладны адказ".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""11.30 to 12.15. I don't know the e..."
links.english: "11.30 to 12.15. I don't know the exact time. Around midnight."
links.polish: „Między 23:30 a 0:15. Nie wiem dokładnie. Około północy”.
links.belarusian: "Між 23:30 і 0:15. Дакладна не ведаю. Прыкладна апоўначы".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's okay." He makes a note. "We..."
links.english: "That's okay." He makes a note. "Were you inebriated?"
links.polish: „W porządku” – zapisuje coś w notatniku. „Czy była pani odurzona?”
links.belarusian: "Добра" — занатоўвае нешта ў нататніку. "Ці была вы ў стане ап'янення?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Not as much as usual. He'd done a..."
links.english: "Not as much as usual. He'd done a line. Plus other things. I was drinking."
links.polish: „Nie bardziej niż zwykle. On był po kresce. I innych rzeczach. Ja piłam”.
links.belarusian: "Не больш, чым звычайна. Ён быў пад кайфам. І іншых рэчаў. Я піла".

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Wait -- Titus said she was gurning..."
links.english: Wait -- Titus said she was gurning her jaw off. Much more than usual.
links.polish: Zaraz. Titus mówił, że zaćpała jak wariatka. O wiele mocniej niż zwykle.
links.belarusian: Адразу. Цітус казаў, што яна наркатызавалася як вар'ятка. Значна мацней, чым звычайна.

links.title: You: ""Titus said you looked pretty high.""
links.english: "Titus said you looked pretty high."
links.polish: „Titus mówił, że wyglądała pani na mocno odurzoną”.
links.belarusian: "Тытус казаў, што вы выглядалі моцна ап'янелай".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Oh yeah..." She tilts her head. "I..."
links.english: "Oh yeah..." She tilts her head. "I did one of his lines. Just to clear my head."
links.polish: „O tak...” – przekrzywia głowę. „Wzięłam od niego jedną kreskę. Żeby przewietrzyć sobie w głowie”.
links.belarusian: "О так...", — схіляе галаву. "Я ўзяла ў яго адну палоску. Каб праветрыць сабе ў галаве".

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Good thinking. Clear your head. You..."
links.english: Good thinking. Clear your head. You should clear *your* head... get into his mindset.
links.polish: Dobra myśl. Przewietrzyć sobie w głowie. Ty powinieneś przewietrzyć *w swojej*. Przejmij od niej to nastawienie.
links.belarusian: Добрая думка. Праветрыць сабе ў галаве. Ты павінен праветрыць *у сваёй*. Пераймі ад яе такое стаўленне.

links.title: You: "It doesn't matter. Better not to me..."
links.english: It doesn't matter. Better not to mention it.
links.polish: To bez znaczenia. Lepiej o tym nie wspominać.
links.belarusian: Гэта не мае значэння. Лепш пра гэта не згадваць.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Did you hear or see the shooter in..."
links.english: "Did you hear or see the shooter in the course of this?"
links.polish: „Czy słyszała lub widziała pani osobę, która oddała strzał?”
links.belarusian: "Ці чулі вы або бачылі асобу, якая зрабіла стрэл?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""No.""
links.english: "No."
links.polish: „Nie”.
links.belarusian: "Не".

links.title: You: ""What did you do then?""
links.english: "What did you do then?"
links.polish: „Co pani wtedy zrobiła?”
links.belarusian: "Што вы тады зрабілі?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Nothing. I was trapped. I was stuc..."
links.english: "Nothing. I was trapped. I was stuck in my room -- downstairs. I got some clothes on and crawled back up, drew the blinds. Blood was coming from his mouth -- not a lot. Just a little."
links.polish: „Nic. Byłam jak splątana. Uwięziona w moim pokoju na dole. Zarzuciłam coś na siebie, podkradłam się z powrotem na piętro, zaciągnęłam żaluzje. Z jego ust sączyła się krew. Nie było jej dużo. Odrobina”.
links.belarusian: "Нічога. Я была як у палоне. Зняволеная ў маім пакоі ўнізе. Нацягнула нешта на сябе, падкралася назад наверх, задзёрла жалюзі. З яго вуснаў сачылася кроў. Яе не было шмат. Трохі".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""He was still on the floor. Slouche..."
links.english: "He was still on the floor. Slouched. I couldn't be there with him anymore. So I ran down -- and out of my room. Into the hallway. Down the stairs. I knew there would be people there."
links.polish: „Nadal leżał na podłodze. Zgięty. Był tam, gdzie ja nie mogłam już z nim być. Wybiegłam więc z pokoju na korytarz. Wiedziałam, że na dole są ludzie”.
links.belarusian: "Надаль ляжаў на падлозе. Сагнуты. Ён быў там, дзе я не магла з ім быць. Таму я выбегла з пакоя ў калідор. Я ведала, што ўнізе ёсць людзі".

links.title: Empathy: "Run, woman! Run past them and out i..."
links.english: Run, woman! Run past them and out into the street where it's dark and people move -- to the lorries at the intersection. As far as you can...
links.polish: Biegnij, kobieto! Przebiegnij obok nich, na ulicę, tam, gdzie jest ciemno i chodzą ludzie. Do ciężarówek na skrzyżowaniu. Tak daleko, jak się da...
links.belarusian: Бяжы, жанчына! Прабяжы міма іх, на вуліцу, туды, дзе цёмна і ходзяць людзі. Да грузавікоў на скрыжаванні. Так далёка, як магчыма...

links.title: You: ""Why didn't you run away from here?..."
links.english: "Why didn't you run away from here? As a matter of fact -- why are you here now?"
links.polish: „Czemu pani stąd nie uciekła? Właściwie to czemu jest tu pani w tej chwili?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму вы адсюль не збеглі? Уласна кажучы, чаму вы тут зараз?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I already *ran*. I ran from an ent..."
links.english: "I already *ran*. I ran from an entire isola. There is... I can't run any further. Not with these people. This is as far as it gets."
links.polish: „Ależ *uciekłam*. Uciekłam przed całą isolą. Nie ma... Nie mogę już dalej uciec. Nie przed tymi ludźmi. Tu jest koniec trasy”.
links.belarusian: "Але ж *ўцякла*. Уцякла ад усёй ізолай. Няма... Я больш не магу ўцячы. Не ад гэтых людзей. Тут канец маршруту".

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.english: Say nothing.
links.polish: Nic nie mów.
links.belarusian: Нічога не кажы.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She pulls on the cigarette, looking..."
links.english: She pulls on the cigarette, looking up at the sky. Her hair ripples in the breeze as she stands there, silent.
links.polish: Zaciąga się papierosem ze wzrokiem utkwionym w niebie. Jej włosy falują na wietrze, gdy tak stoi w ciszy.
links.belarusian: Затягваецца цыгарэтай, гледзячы ў неба. Яе валасы лунае на ветры, калі яна так стаіць у цішыні.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Of course. Keep your eyes open for..."
links.english: Of course. Keep your eyes open for the killer instead.
links.polish: Oczywiście. Zamiast tego lepiej rozglądaj się za zabójcą.
links.belarusian: Вядома. Замест гэтага лепш прыглядайся да забойцы.

links.title: Logic: "Of course. Keep your eyes open for..."
links.english: Of course. Keep your eyes open for the killer instead.
links.polish: Oczywiście. Zamiast tego lepiej rozglądaj się za zabójcą.
links.belarusian: Вядома. Замест гэтага лепш азірніся ў пошуках забойцы.

links.title: Logic: "This doesn't fit with the testimony..."
links.english: This doesn't fit with the testimony of Titus Hardie. He said she was higher than usual.
links.polish: To nie pasuje do zeznań Titusa Hardiego. Twierdził, że była bardziej naćpana niż zwykle.
links.belarusian: Гэта не адпавядае сведчанням Тытуса Харды. Ён сцвярджаў, што яна была больш пад наркотыкамі, чым звычайна.

links.title: You: ""Did you hear or see the shooter --..."
links.english: "Did you hear or see the shooter -- at any point?"
links.polish: „Czy słyszała lub widziała pani osobę, która oddała strzał? W jakimkolwiek momencie?”
links.belarusian: "Ці чула або бачыла вы чалавека, які зрабіў стрэл? У любы момант?"

links.title: You: ""Were you inebriated?""
links.english: "Were you inebriated?"
links.polish: „Była pani czymś odurzona?”
links.belarusian: "Ці была спадарыня чымсьці ап'янелая?"

links.title: You: ""What time was this?""
links.english: "What time was this?"
links.polish: „Która była godzina?”
links.belarusian: "Котрая была гадзіна?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She throws it away and immediately..."
links.english: She throws it away and immediately proceeds to light another one.
links.polish: Pozbywa się go i natychmiast przystępuje do zapalenia kolejnego.
links.belarusian: Выкідвае яго і адразу бярэцца за запальванне наступнага.

links.title: You: ""Are you sure you're not making thi..."
links.english: "Are you sure you're not making this up?"
links.polish: „Na pewno pani tego nie zmyśla?”
links.belarusian: "Вы ўпэўнены, што гэтага не выдумляеце?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I'm not lying to you..." She looks..."
links.english: "I'm not lying to you..." She looks down, wincing. Her cigarette has singed her fingers.
links.polish: „Nie okłamuję pana...” – z grymasem bólu przenosi wzrok na papieros, który właśnie poparzył jej palce.
links.belarusian: "Я не падманваю вас..." – з грымасай болю пераводзіць погляд на цыгарэту, якая толькі што апякла ёй пальцы.

Alternate1.english: "I'm not lying to you..." She immediately lights another one.
Alternate1.polish: „Nie okłamuję pana...” – natychmiast zapala kolejnego.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Я не ашукваю вас..." — адразу запальвае наступную.

links.title: Drama: "You *may* sometimes be bad at readi..."
links.english: You *may* sometimes be bad at reading her, but this time, truly -- she's telling you how it really went down.
links.polish: Czasem może *faktycznie* źle ją odczytujesz, ale tym razem rzeczywiście mówi ci, co się tak naprawdę stało.
links.belarusian: Часам можа *сапраўды* дрэнна яе адчытваеш, але гэтым разам яна сапраўды кажа табе, што на самой справе здарылася.

links.title: You: "(Shake your head.) "That's a mother..."
links.english: (Shake your head.) "That's a motherfucker."
links.polish: (Pokręć głową). „Ależ popierdolone”.
links.belarusian: (Пакруці галавой). "Але ж звар'яцела".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yeah, it was a real *motherfucker*..."
links.english: "Yeah, it was a real *motherfucker*... ouch..." She looks down. Her cigarette has singed her fingers.
links.polish: „No, to było dość *popierdolone*... aj...” – spogląda na papieros, którym właśnie oparzyła sobie palce.
links.belarusian: "Ну, гэта было даволі *папярждолена*... ай..." – глядзіць на цыгарэту, якой толькі што апякла пальцы.

Alternate1.english: "Yeah, it was a real *motherfucker*." She immediately lights another one.
Alternate1.polish: „No, to było dość *popierdolone*” – natychmiast zapala kolejnego.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Ну, гэта было даволі *підараскае*" – адразу запальвае наступную.

links.title: You: "(Just nod.) "There are a few questi..."
links.english: (Just nod.) "There are a few questions I have to ask for my report."
links.polish: (Kiwnij tylko głową). „Jest kilka pytań, które muszę zadać na potrzeby mojego meldunku”.
links.belarusian: (Кіўні толькі галавой). "Ёсць некалькі пытанняў, якія я павінен задаць для майго даклада".

Alternate1.english: (Just nod.) "We're going to need more details."
Alternate1.polish: (Kiwnij tylko głową). „Będziemy potrzebowali więcej szczegółów”.
Alternate1.belarusian: (Паківай толькі галавой). "Нам спатрэбіцца больш падрабязнасцей".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She looks down with a wince. Her ci..."
links.english: She looks down with a wince. Her cigarette has singed her fingers.
links.polish: Z grymasem bólu spogląda na papierosa, który właśnie poparzył jej palce.
links.belarusian: З крыўдай болю яна глядзіць на цыгарэту, якая толькі што абпаліла ёй пальцы.

Alternate1.english: "Sure." She immediately lights another one.
Alternate1.polish: „Pewnie” – natychmiast zapala kolejnego.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Пэўна" — адразу запальвае наступную.

links.title: You: ""You don't have to continue if you..."
links.english: "You don't have to continue if you don't want to."
links.polish: „Nie musi pani mówić dalej, jeśli pani nie chce”.
links.belarusian: "Вы не павінны працягваць гаварыць, калі не хочаце".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""No. I want to. Let's get this done.""
links.english: "No. I want to. Let's get this done."
links.polish: „Nie. Chcę. Miejmy to za sobą”.
links.belarusian: "Не. Хачу. Давайце пакончым з гэтым".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's okay. Tell us as much as you'..."
links.english: "It's okay. Tell us as much as you're comfortable with." He waits for her to continue.
links.polish: „Nie naciskamy. Proszę powiedzieć tyle, ile jest pani w stanie” – oznajmia porucznik i czeka na dalsze zeznania.
links.belarusian: "Мы не ціснім. Калі ласка, скажыце столькі, колькі можаце", — заўважыў лейтэнант і чакае далейшых паказанняў.

links.title: You: ""Alright. Tell me as much as you're..."
links.english: "Alright. Tell me as much as you're comfortable with."
links.polish: „Dobrze. Proszę powiedzieć tyle, ile jest pani w stanie”.
links.belarusian: "Добра. Калі ласка, скажыце столькі, колькі можаце".

links.title: Composure: "Her chest rises and falls with each..."
links.english: Her chest rises and falls with each word. She keeps herself together, and says it...
links.polish: Jej klatka piersiowa unosi się i opada z każdym słowem. Trzymając się w garści, mówi...
links.belarusian: Яе грудна клетка падымаецца і апускаецца з кожным словам. Трымаючы сябе ў руках, яна кажа...

links.title: You: ""What happened after you ran downst..."
links.english: "What happened after you ran downstairs?"
links.polish: „Co się stało po tym, jak zbiegła pani na dół?”
links.belarusian: "Што здарылася пасля таго, як вы збеглі ўніз?"

Alternate1.english: "Let's continue with what happened after you ran downstairs. What did you do after treating the body?"
Alternate1.polish: „Porozmawiajmy jeszcze o tym, co się stało, jak zbiegła pani na dół. Co pani zrobiła, kiedy już skończyła pani z ciałem?”
Alternate1.belarusian: "Пагаворым яшчэ пра тое, што адбылося, як вы збеглі ўніз. Што вы зрабілі, калі ўжо скончылі з целам?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Ruby went outside to talk to Titus..."
links.english: "Ruby went outside to talk to Titus and the boys. I was just... looking at Lely. In the bathroom. I had to put his clothes back on. His armour too. It was tough, but I've seen him take it off and put it on many times."
links.polish: „Ruby wyszła, żeby pogadać z Titusem i chłopakami. A ja tylko... patrzyłam na Lely'ego. W łazience. Musiałam go ubrać. I założyć mu ten jego pancerz. Nie było łatwo, ale wiele razy widziałam, jak go zakłada i zdejmuje”.
links.belarusian: "Рубі выйшла, каб пагаварыць з Тытусам і хлопцамі. А я толькі... глядзела на Лелі. У ваннай. Я павінна была яго апрануць. І надзець на яго гэты яго панцыр. Было нялёгка, але я шмат разоў бачыла, як ён яго апранае і здымае".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""It took Ruby maybe half an hour to..."
links.english: "It took Ruby maybe half an hour to come back with Titus. I'd gotten him ready by then, they carried him out. I knew what they were going to do -- make it look like a hanging. Ruby said they would."
links.polish: „Po jakiejś pół godzinie Ruby wróciła z Titusem. Do tego czasu zdążyłam przygotować Lely'ego, więc od razu go wynieśli. Wiedziałam, co zamierzają – chcieli upozorować powieszenie. Ruby mi powiedziała”.
links.belarusian: "Праз паўгадзіны Рубі вярнулася з Тытусам. Да таго часу я паспела падрыхтаваць Лелі, таму яго адразу вынеслі. Я ведала, што яны задумалі — хацелі інсцэнаваць павешанне. Рубі сказала мне".

links.title: You: ""What did you do while they were ha..."
links.english: "What did you do while they were hanging him?"
links.polish: „Co pani robiła, kiedy go wieszali?”
links.belarusian: "Што вы рабілі, калі яго вешалі?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Ruby said to wait here. She also s..."
links.english: "Ruby said to wait here. She also said I wouldn't see her for a while; that we should lay low or something... so I did."
links.polish: „Ruby kazała mi tutaj czekać. Powiedziała też, że przez pewien czas nie będziemy się widzieć; że powinnyśmy się przyczaić czy coś takiego... Tak też zrobiłam”.
links.belarusian: "Рубі сказала мне чакаць тут. Яна таксама сказала, што нейкі час мы не будзем бачыцца; што мы павінны засадавацца ці нешта такое... Так я і зрабіла".

links.title: You: ""This Ruby -- where is this Ruby no..."
links.english: "This Ruby -- where is this Ruby now?"
links.polish: „Ta Ruby – gdzie ona teraz jest?”
links.belarusian: "Та Рубі — дзе яна зараз?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I don't know. I haven't seen her s..."
links.english: "I don't know. I haven't seen her since."
links.polish: „Nie wiem. Od tamtej pory jej nie widziałam”.
links.belarusian: "Не ведаю. З таго часу я яе не бачыла".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We will need to take this question..."
links.english: "We will need to take this question to the Hardie boys."
links.polish: „Musimy zadać to pytanie chłopakom Hardiego”.
links.belarusian: "Мы павінны задаць гэтае пытанне хлопцам Харды".

links.title: Logic: "Interesting. Why did this Ruby go t..."
links.english: Interesting. Why did this Ruby go through so much trouble -- to hide something someone *else* did? Look into this later!
links.polish: Ciekawe. Czemu ta Ruby narobiła sobie tyle kłopotu, żeby ukryć coś, co zrobił *ktoś inny*? Przyjrzyj się temu później!
links.belarusian: Цікава. Чаму гэтая Рубі нарабіла сабе столькі клопату, каб схаваць нешта, што зрабіў *хтосьці іншы*? Паглядзі на гэта пазней!

links.title: Volition: "What are you doing?"
links.english: What are you doing?
links.polish: Co ty robisz?
links.belarusian: Што ты робіш?

links.title: Logic: "Coming up with a theory. She said R..."
links.english: Coming up with a theory. She said Ruby *knew* something was wrong before she said anything. How come? It was loud downstairs, she couldn't have heard the shot...
links.polish: Tworzy mi się taka hipoteza: jak twierdzi, Ruby *wiedziała*, że coś jest nie tak, zanim padły jakiekolwiek słowa. Jakim cudem? Na dole było głośno, nie mogła usłyszeć strzału...
links.belarusian: У мяне ўзнікае такая гіпотэза: як сцвярджае, Рубі *ведала*, што нешта не так, да таго, як прагучалі якія-небудзь словы. Як такое магчыма? Унізе было шумна, яна не магла пачуць выстрал...

links.title: Volition: "It is ominous -- you already coming..."
links.english: It is ominous -- you already coming up with theories that put the blame on someone other than Klaasje.
links.polish: Złowrogie. Już teraz tworzysz hipotezy obciążające kogoś innego niż Klaasje.
links.belarusian: Злавесна. Ты ўжо ствараеш гіпотэзы, якія абвінавачваюць кагосьці іншага, акрамя Клаасье.

links.title: Volition: "There is something suspicious about..."
links.english: There is something suspicious about that theory, but you can't put your finger on it.
links.polish: Coś w tej wersji wydarzeń jest podejrzanego, ale nie umiesz powiedzieć dokładnie, co właściwie.
links.belarusian: Нешта ў гэтай версіі падзей здаецца падазроным, але вы не можаце дакладна сказаць, што менавіта.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Sylvie was tending the bar." She l..."
links.english: "Sylvie was tending the bar." She looks down. "A lot of people were there. The Hardies were at the table in front of the stage, I think the Union box was full..."
links.polish: „Za barem była Sylvie” – opuszcza wzrok. „Kręciło się tam sporo osób. Chłopaki Hardiego zajmowali stolik pod sceną, salka związkowa była chyba pełna...”
links.belarusian: "За барнай стойкай была Сільві," – апускае позірк. "Там круцілася шмат людзей. Хлопцы Хардзі займалі столік пад сцэнай, зала прафсаюзу была, напэўна, запоўненая...".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Ruby was there too. They were havi..."
links.english: "Ruby was there too. They were having such a good time..." She pauses. "I sat down and they all welcomed me. I didn't even have to say anything, Ruby *knew* something was wrong."
links.polish: „Ruby też tam była. Świetnie się bawili...” – przerywa. „Przysiadłam się i wszyscy mnie przywitali. Nie musiałam nic mówić – Ruby *wiedziała*, że coś jest nie tak”.
links.belarusian: "Рубі таксама была там. Цудоўна весяліліся..." – перапыняе. "Я села побач, і ўсе мяне прывіталі. Мне не трэба было нічога казаць – Рубі *ведала*, што нешта не так".

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Ruby?!"
links.english: Ruby?!
links.polish: Ruby?!
links.belarusian: Рубін?!

links.title: You: ""Before we continue -- who is Ruby?""
links.english: "Before we continue -- who is Ruby?"
links.polish: „Zanim przejdziemy dalej... Kim jest Ruby?”
links.belarusian: "Перш чым мы працягнем далей... Хто такая Рубі?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Ruby. You know. The leader.""
links.english: "Ruby. You know. The leader."
links.polish: „No Ruby. Wie pan, liderka”.
links.belarusian: "Не Рубі. Ведаеце, лідэрка".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The leader? Of what?""
links.english: "The leader? Of what?"
links.polish: „Liderka? Czego?”
links.belarusian: "Лідэрка? Чаго?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""The Hardie boys," she says as if i..."
links.english: "The Hardie boys," she says as if it's self-evident.
links.polish: „Chłopaków Hardiego” – odpowiada, jakby było to zupełnie oczywiste.
links.belarusian: "Хлопцаў Хардзі" – адказвае, як быццам гэта абсалютна відавочна.

links.title: You: ""I thought Hardie was the leader of..."
links.english: "I thought Hardie was the leader of the Hardie boys."
links.polish: „Myślałem, że to Hardie jest liderem chłopaków Hardiego”.
links.belarusian: "Я думаў, што гэта Харды з'яўляецца лідэрам хлопцаў Харды".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Well. Nominally yes. Ruby's the on..."
links.english: "Well. Nominally yes. Ruby's the one they go to when things happen. Like, things they need taken care of. She's the organizer."
links.polish: „Formalnie tak, ale to do Ruby uderzają, kiedy coś się dzieje. W sensie, kiedy trzeba coś załatwić. Ona jest od organizowania akcji”.
links.belarusian: "Фармальна так, але гэта да Рубі звяртаюцца, калі нешта адбываецца. У сэнсе, калі трэба нешта ўладзіць. Яна займаецца арганізацыяй акцый".

links.title: Authority: "This Ruby, in her phrasing, is entr..."
links.english: This Ruby, in her phrasing, is entrusted with great power. She trusts her. So do the others.
links.polish: Ta Ruby, jak mówi Klaasje, dysponuje wielką siłą. Cieszy się jej zaufaniem. Pozostałych też.
links.belarusian: Та Рубі, як кажа Кляасе, валодае вялікай сілай. Яна карыстаецца яе даверам. Рэшта таксама.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Would you say she is the..." He lo..."
links.english: "Would you say she is the..." He looks at you. "Eighth Hardie boy?"
links.polish: „Czy zgodziłaby się pani, że ona jest...” – zerka na ciebie – „...ósmym chłopakiem Hardiego?”
links.belarusian: "Ці згадзілася б вы, што яна..." – зіркае на цябе – "...восьмы хлопец Хардзі?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Why not.""
links.english: "Why not."
links.polish: „Czemu nie”.
links.belarusian: "Чаму не".

links.title: You: ""Would you say she is... the eighth..."
links.english: "Would you say she is... the eighth Hardie boy?"
links.polish: „Powiedziałaby pani, że jest ona... ósmym chłopakiem Hardiego?”
links.belarusian: "Сказалі б вы, што гэта... восьмы хлопец Хардзі?"

links.title: Suggestion: "Does she also *party* with Ruby, ho..."
links.english: Does she also *party* with Ruby, however?
links.polish: Czy jednak z Ruby też *imprezuje*?
links.belarusian: Ці Рубі таксама *святкуе*?

links.title: You: ""Did you *party* with Ruby too?""
links.english: "Did you *party* with Ruby too?"
links.polish: „Z Ruby też pani *imprezowała*?”
links.belarusian: "З Рубі таксама пані *святкавала*?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""No..." She smiles nervously. The b..."
links.english: "No..." She smiles nervously. The beads of her teeth shine.
links.polish: „Nie...” – uśmiecha się nerwowo. Jej zęby błyszczą jak paciorki.
links.belarusian: "Не..." — яна нервова ўсміхаецца. Яе зубы блішчаць, як пацеркі.

links.title: Suggestion: "Still -- there is something there...."
links.english: Still -- there is something there. She won't tell you now.
links.polish: A jednak... coś się w tym kryje. Ale teraz ci tego nie powie.
links.belarusian: Аднак... нешта ў гэтым тоіцца. Але цяпер ён табе гэтага не скажа.

links.title: You: "Better not to."
links.english: Better not to.
links.polish: Może lepiej nie.
links.belarusian: Можа лепш не.

links.title: Suggestion: "What are you trying to be -- tactfu..."
links.english: What are you trying to be -- tactful? She wouldn't mind. Go on then...
links.polish: Czego ty próbujesz? Taktowności? Jej wszystko jedno. Przejdź dalej...
links.belarusian: Што ты спрабуеш? Тактоўнасці? Яе ўсё роўна. Ідзі далей...

links.title: You: ""Leader? Of what?""
links.english: "Leader? Of what?"
links.polish: „Liderka? Czego?”
links.belarusian: "Лідарка? Чаго?"

links.title: You: ""Okay, let's go on. What then?""
links.english: "Okay, let's go on. What then?"
links.polish: „Dobrze. Przejdźmy dalej. Co było potem?”
links.belarusian: "Добра. Пераходзім далей. Што было потым?"

Alternate1.english: "*Now* let's go on. What happened then?"
Alternate1.polish: „Dobrze, *teraz* przejdźmy dalej. Co było potem?”
Alternate1.belarusian: "Добра, *зараз* пяройдзем далей. Што было потым?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Well, Ruby said let's talk upstair..."
links.english: "Well, Ruby said let's talk upstairs. I showed her the room... I've known these people since December, they know my situation. That I can't leave a paper trail. Ruby was the first one I told..."
links.polish: „Ruby zabrała mnie na górę. Pokazałam jej pokój... Znałam tych ludzi od grudnia, byli świadomi mojego położenia. Tego, że moje nazwisko nie może nigdzie figurować. To Ruby powiedziałam jako pierwszej...”
links.belarusian: "Рубі павяла мяне наверх. Я паказала ёй пакой... Я ведала гэтых людзей з снежня, яны былі ў курсе майго становішча. Тое, што маё прозвішча не можа нідзе фігураваць. Гэта Рубі я сказала першай..."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""She said she'd take care of this...."
links.english: "She said she'd take care of this. It's what she does, you know. Take care of things. I helped her get the body to the bathroom -- we used a belt to pull him up under the shower. To keep him upright."
links.polish: „Zapewniła mnie, że to załatwi. Bo na tym się zna. Na załatwianiu różnych spraw. Pomogłam jej przenieść ciało do łazienki. Użyliśmy paska, żeby postawić go pod prysznicem, utrzymać w takiej pozycji”.
links.belarusian: "Яна мяне запэўніла, што ўсё ўладзіць. Бо на гэтым яна разумеецца. На ўладкаванні розных спраў. Я дапамагла ёй перанесці цела ў ванную. Мы выкарысталі рамень, каб паставіць яго пад душам, утрымаць у такім стане".

links.title: Perception (Sight): "To mislead you! They were tampering..."
links.english: To mislead you! They were tampering with the body.
links.polish: Żeby was zwieść! Grzebały przy ciele.
links.belarusian: Каб вас ашукаць! Капаліся каля цела.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""To produce lividity matching a han..."
links.english: "To produce lividity matching a hanging?"
links.polish: „Aby upozorować zasinienie odpowiadające powieszeniu?”
links.belarusian: "Каб імітаваць сінякі, якія адпавядаюць павешанню?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yes.""
links.english: "Yes."
links.polish: „Tak”.
links.belarusian: "Так".

links.title: Visual Calculus: "This is concurrent with your doubts..."
links.english: This is concurrent with your doubts -- at the autopsy -- about the colouring being...
links.polish: To by pasowało do twoich wątpliwości podczas autopsji. Że ubarwienie było...
links.belarusian: Гэта б падыходзіла да тваіх сумневаў падчас аўтапсіі. Што афарбоўка была...

links.title: You: ""I knew it -- the colouring in his..."
links.english: "I knew it -- the colouring in his lower limbs looked faint."
links.polish: „Wiedziałem. Jego dolne kończyny były słabo ubarwione”.
links.belarusian: "Я ведаў. Яго ніжнія канечнасці былі слаба афарбаваны".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""About half an hour had passed sinc..."
links.english: "About half an hour had passed since the moment of death?"
links.polish: „Od chwili zgonu minęło około pół godziny?”
links.belarusian: "З моманту смерці прайшло прыкладна паўгадзіны?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She nods."
links.english: She nods.
links.polish: Kiwa głową.
links.belarusian: Ківае галавой.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You were late. The marks would be..."
links.english: "You were late. The marks would be faint by that time." He makes a small pointing motion with his pen -- it's meant for you.
links.polish: „Spóźniłyście się. Po takim czasie zasinienie jest blade” – wykonuje niewielki gest swoim długopisem – miałeś rację.
links.belarusian: "Спазніліся. Пасля такога часу сіняк ужо блядны" — выконвае невялікі жэст сваім асадкам — ты меў рацыю.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "In honour of another *precise* fore..."
links.english: In honour of another *precise* forensic observation.
links.polish: To gest na cześć kolejnego *precyzyjnego* spostrzeżenia podczas sekcji.
links.belarusian: Гэта жэст у гонар чарговага *дакладнага* назірання падчас секцыі.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "You have it in you to be a champion..."
links.english: You have it in you to be a champion. Keep your head in the game now...
links.polish: Masz w sobie to coś, co mają mistrzowie. Skup się tylko na zadaniu...
links.belarusian: У цябе ёсць тое, што маюць чэмпіёны. Сканцэнтруйся толькі на заданні...

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "In honour of that *precise* forensi..."
links.english: In honour of that *precise* forensic remark, officer. A real hit.
links.polish: To gest na cześć tej *precyzyjnej* uwagi podczas sekcji. Strzał w sedno.
links.belarusian: Гэта жэст у гонар гэтага *дакладнага* назірання падчас секцыі. Пападанне ў кропку.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She's silent. Just looks at her cig..."
links.english: She's silent. Just looks at her cigarette.
links.polish: Milczy, przyglądając się trzymanemu w dłoni papierosowi.
links.belarusian: Маўчыць, назіраючы за цыгарэтай у руцэ.

links.title: You: "Better not to remark."
links.english: Better not to remark.
links.polish: Lepiej powstrzymać się od tej uwagi.
links.belarusian: Лепш устрымацца ад гэтага каментара.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "This tactful approach will rob you..."
links.english: This tactful approach will rob you the glory, but hey, all I care about is angles and timetables. The loss is yours.
links.polish: To taktowne podejście pozbawi cię wszelkiej chwały, ale cóż – mnie obchodzą tylko kąty strzału i czasy wydarzeń. Tracisz jedynie ty.
links.belarusian: Гэта тактоўнае падыходжанне пазбавіць цябе ўсялякай славы, але што ж – мяне цікавяць толькі вуглы стрэлу і час падзей. Толькі ты страчваеш.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We *completely* missed the tamperi..."
links.english: "We *completely* missed the tampering. Looks like you got there in time. What was this -- twenty minutes after death?"
links.polish: „*Zupełnie* przeoczyliśmy próby zacierania śladów. Wygląda na to, że działałyście sprawnie. Od zgonu minęło ile – jakieś dwadzieścia minut?”
links.belarusian: "*Зусім* прапусцілі спробы сцерці сляды. Відавочна, што вы дзейнічалі спраўна. Са смерці прайшло колькі – каля дваццаці хвілін?"

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Oops..."
links.english: Oops...
links.polish: Ups...
links.belarusian: Ой...

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""About twenty, yes. Ruby explained..."
links.english: "About twenty, yes. Ruby explained it would make the blood... you know what it does." She looks at the ground. Then raises her light brown eyes to meet yours.
links.polish: „Tak, mniej więcej dwadzieścia. Ruby wyjaśniła, że w ten sposób krew... no, sami wiecie” – spuszcza wzrok, ale zaraz znów widzisz jej piwne oczy.
links.belarusian: "Так, прыкладна дваццаць. Рубі патлумачыла, што такім чынам кроў... ну, самі ведаеце" — апускае вочы, але адразу зноў бачыць яе піўныя вочы.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""How could we have *missed* that......"
links.english: "How could we have *missed* that..." He shakes his head. "And when was the tampering -- twenty minutes after death?"
links.polish: „Jak mogliśmy to *przeoczyć*...” – kręci głową. „Kiedy nastąpiło to zacieranie śladów? Dwadzieścia minut po zgonie?”
links.belarusian: "Як мы маглі гэта *прапусціць*..." – круціць галавой. "Калі адбылося гэта сціранне слядоў? Дваццаць хвілін пасля смерці?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's a shame we never got around t..."
links.english: "It's a shame we never got around to doing a thorough autopsy..." He shakes his head. "And when was the tampering -- twenty minutes after death?"
links.polish: „Wielka szkoda, że nie znaleźliśmy czasu na przeprowadzenie szczegółowej autopsji...” – kręci głową. „Kiedy nastąpiło to zacieranie śladów? Dwadzieścia minut po zgonie?”
links.belarusian: "Вялікая шкада, што мы не знайшлі часу на правядзенне дэталёвай аўтапсіі..." – круціць галавой. "Калі адбылося гэтае знішчэнне слядоў? Дваццаць хвілін пасля смерці?"

links.title: You: ""Then what did you do?""
links.english: "Then what did you do?"
links.polish: „Co potem zrobiłyście?”
links.belarusian: "А што вы зрабілі пасля?"

links.title: You: ""That's enough. I had another quest..."
links.english: "That's enough. I had another question."
links.polish: „Wystarczy. Mam inne pytanie”.
links.belarusian: "Дастаткова. У мяне іншае пытанне".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She blinks, without averting her ga..."
links.english: She blinks, without averting her gaze.
links.polish: Mruga, nie unikając twojego wzroku.
links.belarusian: Міргай, не ўхіляючыся ад твайго позірку.

links.title: Logic: "They tampered with the body to disg..."
links.english: They tampered with the body to disguise the cause of death.
links.polish: Grzebały przy ciele, żeby zamaskować faktyczną przyczynę śmierci.
links.belarusian: Капаліся ў целе, каб схаваць сапраўдную прычыну смерці.

links.title: You: ""You were tampering with the body.""
links.english: "You were tampering with the body."
links.polish: „Grzebałyście przy ciele”.
links.belarusian: "Капаліся каля цела".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yes. Ruby said the blood in him......"
links.english: "Yes. Ruby said the blood in him... would look like a hanging."
links.polish: „Tak. Ruby mówiła, że krew w nim... będzie sugerowała powieszenie”.
links.belarusian: "Так. Рубі казала, што кроў у ім... будзе сведчыць пра павешанне".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No -- not just yet." He turns to t..."
links.english: "No -- not just yet." He turns to the woman. "Who is *Ruby*?"
links.polish: „Nie – jeszcze nie” – przerywa porucznik i zwraca się do kobiety: „Kim jest *Ruby*?”
links.belarusian: "Не — яшчэ не", — перарывае лейтэнант і звяртаецца да жанчыны: "Хто такая *Ruby*?"

links.title: Reaction Speed: "*Let's go on*, what are you talking..."
links.english: *Let's go on*, what are you talking about? Did you forget how to cop? There's a new actor in the investigation -- change the question immediately!
links.polish: *Przejdźmy dalej*? O czym ty mówisz? Zapomniałeś, co to znaczy być gliną? W całym śledztwie pojawiła się nowa postać. Zmień w tej chwili pytanie!
links.belarusian: *Пераходзім далей*? Пра што ты кажаш? Забыліся, што значыць быць паліцыянтам? У ўсім расследаванні з'явіўся новы персанаж. Змяні пытанне ў гэты момант!

links.title: Volition: "I can't restrain this one. The need..."
links.english: I can't restrain this one. The need to *cop* is too strong. You just need to ask it.
links.polish: Nie umiem tego powstrzymać – potrzeba *policyjności* jest zbyt wielka. Musisz po prostu spytać.
links.belarusian: Я не магу гэтага стрымаць — патрэба ў *паліцэйскасці* занадта вялікая. Ты павінен проста спытаць.

links.title: Logic: "I don't understand what you're doin..."
links.english: I don't understand what you're doing detective -- *go on*? A new name just emerged -- Ruby! This is important. Change the question immediately.
links.polish: Nie rozumiem, co ty robisz, detektywie. *Przejdźmy dalej*? Padło właśnie nowe imię – Ruby! To ważne. Zmień natychmiast pytanie.
links.belarusian: Я не разумею, што ты робіш, дэтэктыў. *Пераходзім далей*? Прачулося новае імя – Рубі! Гэта важна. Змяні пытанне неадкладна.

links.title: You: ""When it happened -- did you hear a..."
links.english: "When it happened -- did you hear a gunshot?"
links.polish: „Kiedy to się stało, słyszała pani wystrzał?”
links.belarusian: "Калі гэта здарылася, вы чулі стрэл?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""When he was shot?" She thinks. "I..."
links.english: "When he was shot?" She thinks. "I may have. I don't know. I couldn't hear anything over the glass exploding."
links.polish: „Kiedy zginął?” – zastanawia się. „Możliwe. Nie wiem. Trudno było coś jeszcze usłyszeć pośród hałasu eksplodującego szkła”.
links.belarusian: "Калі ён загінуў?" — задумваецца. "Магчыма. Не ведаю. Цяжка было яшчэ нешта пачуць сярод шуму выбуховага шкла".

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "The gunshot wasn't that loud? This..."
links.english: The gunshot wasn't that loud? This is something to keep in mind when assessing the distance of the shot.
links.polish: Strzał nie był aż tak głośny? To coś, o czym warto pamiętać podczas oceniania, z jakiej odległości go oddano.
links.belarusian: Стрэл не быў такім гучным? Гэта нешта, пра што варта памятаць пры ацэнцы таго, з якой адлегласці ён зроблены.

links.title: You: ""Did you kill him?""
links.english: "Did you kill him?"
links.polish: „Pani go zabiła?”
links.belarusian: "Спадарыня яго забіла?"

Alternate1.english: "Did you kill Lely?"
Alternate1.polish: „Pani zabiła Lely'ego?”
Alternate1.belarusian: "Пані забіла Лелі?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""What?" She gathers the last vestig..."
links.english: "What?" She gathers the last vestiges of her strength. "Why would I put myself through this... insanity? Get myself cornered like this?" There's a silence.
links.polish: „Co?” – próbuje wykrzesać z siebie resztki energii. „Dlaczego miałabym fundować sobie ten... obłęd? Zapędzić się w kozi róg”. Gdy energia ta się wyczerpuje, zapada cisza.
links.belarusian: "Што?" – спрабуе выцяснуць з сябе рэшткі энергіі. "Чаму б мне фінансаваць гэты... шал? Загнаць сябе ў тупік". Калі гэтая энергія знікае, настае цішыня.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "The wind picks up. "He wouldn't hav..."
links.english: The wind picks up. "He wouldn't have died if it weren't for me -- I know that. But I would *never* hurt him."
links.polish: Wiatr przybiera na sile. „Nie zginąłby, gdyby nie ja. Wiem o tym. Ale *nigdy* świadomie nie zrobiłabym mu krzywdy”.
links.belarusian: Вецер набірае сілу. "Ён бы не загінуў, калі б не я. Я гэта ведаю. Але *ніколі* свядома не зрабіла б яму крыўды".

links.title: Half Light: "Rage? Who knows the *dark currents*..."
links.english: Rage? Who knows the *dark currents* where lovers go?
links.polish: Wściekłość? Któż wie, jakie *mroczne prądy* niosą kochanków?
links.belarusian: Лютасць? Хто ведае, якія *цёмныя плыні* нясуць закаханых?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "All kinds of *crazy* things happen..."
links.english: All kinds of *crazy* things happen when drugs are involved... sweet, sweet drugs.
links.polish: Kiedy w grę wchodzą narkotyki, dzieją się najróżniejsze *wariactwa*... Kochane narkotyki.
links.belarusian: Калі ў справу ўступаюць наркотыкі, адбываюцца самыя розныя *шаленствы*... Каханыя наркотыкі.

links.title: Suggestion: "It could have been a *desire* murde..."
links.english: It could have been a *desire* murder. Maybe an act of jealousy?
links.polish: To mogło być morderstwo *w afekcie*. Czyn motywowany zazdrością?
links.belarusian: Гэта магло быць забойства *ў афекце*. Чын, матываваны рэўнасцю?

links.title: Logic: "He was a serviceman. He must have h..."
links.english: He was a serviceman. He must have had a gun lying around. Close to her hand -- a  military weapon using *jacketed ammunition*.
links.polish: Był żołdakiem. Gdzieś tam musiała leżeć jego broń. Blisko jej dłoni. Wojskowa broń na *płaszczową amunicję*.
links.belarusian: Ён быў салдатам. Дзесьці там павінна была ляжаць яго зброя. Блізка яе далоні. Вайсковая зброя на *абалоненае боепрыпасы*.

links.title: Volition: "*Now* you guys suddenly have theori..."
links.english: *Now* you guys suddenly have theories pouring out? When they're obviously just stabs in the dark...
links.polish: *Teraz* nagle wysnuwacie coraz to nowe hipotezy? Ewidentnie po prostu zgadując...
links.belarusian: *Цяпер* раптам вылучаеце ўсё новыя і новыя гіпотэзы? Відавочна, проста здагадваючыся...

links.title: You: ""Downstairs people have this *crazy..."
links.english: "Downstairs people have this *crazy* idea that you killed him."
links.polish: „Ludzie na dole wpadli na *wariacką* myśl, że to pani go zabiła”.
links.belarusian: "Людзі ўнізе прыйшлі да *вар'яцкай* думкі, што гэта пані яго забіла".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I'm sad to hear that. They must ha..."
links.english: "I'm sad to hear that. They must have said it in some fit of frustration, or under pressure. They couldn't have meant it. I've talked to them after it happened -- *no one* has implicated me."
links.polish: „Przykro mi to słyszeć. Może powiedzieli tak w nerwach albo pod naciskiem. Na pewno tak nie myślą. Rozmawiałam z nimi po tym wszystkim i *nikt* mnie nie winił”.
links.belarusian: "Мне шкада гэта чуць. Магчыма, яны сказалі гэта ў нервовым стане або пад націскам. Напэўна, яны так не думаюць. Я размаўляла з імі пасля ўсяго гэтага, і *ніхто* мяне не вінаваціў".

links.title: Half Light: "She's getting scared now. Of you --..."
links.english: She's getting scared now. Of you -- the downstairs people. All of it.
links.polish: Zaczyna się bać. Ciebie. Ludzi z dołu. Wszystkiego.
links.belarusian: Пачынае баяцца. Цябе. Людзей знізу. Усяго.

links.title: You: ""It's okay if you did it in self de..."
links.english: "It's okay if you did it in self defence."
links.polish: „To nic złego, jeśli zrobiła to pani w samoobronie”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта нічога дрэннага, калі вы зрабілі гэта ў самаабароне".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I did not kill him to defend mysel..."
links.english: "I did not kill him to defend myself from rape," she says. "I told you before. That wasn't what happened."
links.polish: „Nie zabiłam go w obronie przed gwałtem” – tłumaczy. „Przecież już mówiłam. To nie tak było”.
links.belarusian: "Я не забіла яго ў абароне ад згвалтавання", — тлумачыць. "Ж я ж ужо казала. Гэта было не так".

links.title: Drama: "True, sire. 'Tis true."
links.english: True, sire. 'Tis true.
links.polish: Prawda, szanowny panie. To prawda.
links.belarusian: Праўда, паважаны спадар. Гэта праўда.

links.title: You: ""Who among us, having been in love,..."
links.english: "Who among us, having been in love, can say they haven't *thought* about it?"
links.polish: „Kto z nas, o ile zaznał miłości, może powiedzieć, że o tym *nie myślał*?”
links.belarusian: "Хто з нас, калі спазнаў каханне, можа сказаць, што пра гэта *не думаў*?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""What? Fucking themselves over for..."
links.english: "What? Fucking themselves over for no reason? This is not what happened, officer."
links.polish: „O czym? O spierdoleniu wszystkiego bez powodu? Nie, nie tak to było”.
links.belarusian: "Пра што? Пра тое, каб усё сапсаваць без прычыны? Не, не так гэта было".

links.title: You: ""Desires drive people *loco*...""
links.english: "Desires drive people *loco*..."
links.polish: „Żądze sprawiają, że ludziom *odbija*”.
links.belarusian: "Пажаданні прымушаюць людзей "страчваць галаву"".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She simply shakes her head."
links.english: She simply shakes her head.
links.polish: Kręci jedynie głową.
links.belarusian: Толькі краціць галавой.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "She *has* the training for it. You'..."
links.english: She *has* the training for it. You've known it since she first greeted you. Here on this roof.
links.polish: *Jest* do tego wyszkolona. Wiedziałeś to, od kiedy pierwszy raz cię powitała. Tu, na tym dachu.
links.belarusian: *Яе* для гэтага падрыхтавана. Ты гэта ведаў з таго моманту, як яна ўпершыню вітала цябе. Тут, на гэтым даху.

links.title: You: ""You *have* the training for it. I..."
links.english: "You *have* the training for it. I can see it in your posture, your shoulders..."
links.polish: „*Jest* pani do tego wyszkolona. Widzę to w pani postawie, ramionach...”
links.belarusian: "*Вы* на гэта навучаныя. Я бачу гэта ў вашай паставе, плячах..."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""The work I did -- they don't just..."
links.english: "The work I did -- they don't just send you in with no training. Corporate security is a thing. But I'm not a trained Sam Bo fighter, I've never needed it outside the gym."
links.polish: „Do pracy, jaką się zajmuję, nikt nie wysyła bez odpowiedniego przeszkolenia. Bezpieczeństwo korporacyjne to nie przelewki. Ale nie jestem mistrzynią sam bo i nigdy nie musiałam używać takich zdolności poza salą treningową”.
links.belarusian: "Да працы, якой я займаюся, ніхто не адпраўляе без адпаведнай падрыхтоўкі. Карпаратыўная бяспека — гэта не жарты. Але я не з'яўляюся майстрам, бо ніколі не даводзілася выкарыстоўваць такія здольнасці па-за трэніровачнай залай".

links.title: Half Light: "She's fought outside that *gym* of..."
links.english: She's fought outside that *gym* of hers. That much is clear. Moreover -- she would like to do it now: hit you. It's in her shoulders...
links.polish: Walczyła też poza tą swoją *salą*. To widać jak na dłoni. Co więcej – chciałaby to zrobić i teraz. Uderzyć cię. Zdradza ją napięcie barków...
links.belarusian: Яна змагалася таксама па-за гэтай сваёй *залай*. Гэта відаць як на далоні. Больш за тое — яна хацела б зрабіць гэта і цяпер. Ударыць цябе. Яе выдае напружанне плячэй...

links.title: You: ""Do you want to hit me right now?""
links.english: "Do you want to hit me right now?"
links.polish: „Ma pani ochotę mnie teraz uderzyć?”
links.belarusian: "Ці ёсць у вас жаданне ўдарыць мяне зараз?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yes.""
links.english: "Yes."
links.polish: „Tak”.
links.belarusian: "Так".

links.title: You: ""Why?""
links.english: "Why?"
links.polish: „Dlaczego?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Because I'm under stress." Her mou..."
links.english: "Because I'm under stress." Her mouth is tense, the muscles in her feet tighten.
links.polish: „Bo czuję silne napięcie” – widać to w jej ustach. Dostrzegasz, że napinają się też mięśnie jej stóp.
links.belarusian: "Бо я адчуваю моцнае напружанне" – гэта бачна на яе вуснах. Вы заўважаеце, што нацягваюцца таксама мышцы яе ступняў.

links.title: You: ""Why?""
links.english: "Why?"
links.polish: „Dlaczego?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Because life is hell, officer," sh..."
links.english: "Because life is hell, officer," she finds refuge in her cigarette. It's thin, but it's something.
links.polish: „Bo życie to piekło, panie mundurowy” – otuchę znajduje w swoim papierosie. Chwilową, ale zawsze to coś.
links.belarusian: "Бо жыццё — гэта пекла, пане афіцэру", — заспакаенне знаходзіць у сваёй цыгарэце. Часовае, але ўсё адно нешта.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We'll try to make it less stressfu..."
links.english: "We'll try to make it less stressful, miss. But these are questions we *need* to ask."
links.polish: „Postaramy się, aby ta rozmowa była mniej stresująca. Ale *musimy* zadać te pytania”.
links.belarusian: "Мы пастараемся, каб гэтая размова была менш напружанай. Але *мы павінны* задаць гэтыя пытанні".

links.title: You: ""Relax. One more thing.""
links.english: "Relax. One more thing."
links.polish: „Spokojnie. Jeszcze jedna rzecz”.
links.belarusian: "Спакойна. Яшчэ адна рэч".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Sure." She nods and relaxes her ha..."
links.english: "Sure." She nods and relaxes her hands.
links.polish: „Jasne” – kiwa głową i rozluźnia mięśnie dłoni.
links.belarusian: "Вядома" — ківае галавой і расслабляе мышцы далоні.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Samaran boxing, or Sam Bo. Graceful..."
links.english: Samaran boxing, or Sam Bo. Graceful martial arts stuff -- stealth, cleverness, and cool.
links.polish: Samarski boks, sam bo. Pełna wdzięku sztuka walki. Ukradkowość, spryt i kozactwo.
links.belarusian: Самарскі бокс, сам бо. Поўная грацыі мастацтва бою. Украдлівасць, хітрасць і казакства.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.english: Say nothing.
links.polish: Nic nie mów.
links.belarusian: Нічога не кажы.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "Her shoulders do not shake, despite..."
links.english: Her shoulders do not shake, despite the strength it takes to keep herself from crying.
links.polish: Jej ramiona pozostają nieruchome pomimo wysiłku, jaki wkłada w powstrzymanie wybuchu płaczu.
links.belarusian: Яе рукі застаюцца нерухомымі, нягледзячы на намаганні, якія яна ўкладае ў тое, каб стрымаць слёзы.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "She has the training for it. Two, m..."
links.english: She has the training for it. Two, maybe three years of self defence? Her body is hard and lean underneath that jump suit...
links.polish: Jest do tego wyszkolona. Dwa czy trzy lata nauki samoobrony... Ciało pod tym kombinezonem jest twarde i umięśnione...
links.belarusian: Яна да гэтага падрыхтаваная. Два ці тры гады навучання самабароне... Цела пад гэтым камбінезонам цвёрдае і мускулістае...

links.title: You: ""Drugs were an *integral* part of y..."
links.english: "Drugs were an *integral* part of your relationship. Perhaps they contributed to its end?"
links.polish: „Narkotyki były *nieodłączną* częścią waszego związku. Może odegrały też rolę w jego zakończeniu?”
links.belarusian: "Наркотыкі былі *неад'емнай* часткай вашых адносін. Магчыма, яны адыгралі таксама ролю ў іх завяршэнні?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""What does that mean?""
links.english: "What does that mean?"
links.polish: „Co to znaczy?”
links.belarusian: "Што гэта значыць?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Do drugs make you aggressive?""
links.english: "Do drugs make you aggressive?"
links.polish: „Czy narkotyki sprawiają, że staje się pani agresywna?”
links.belarusian: "Ці робяць наркотыкі вас агрэсіўнай?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""No." She shakes her head. "People..."
links.english: "No." She shakes her head. "People don't take drugs to kill each other -- they take them to feel okay with each other."
links.polish: „Nie” – kręci głową. „Ludzie nie biorą narkotyków, żeby się nawzajem mordować. Robią to po to, żeby dobrze się ze sobą czuć”.
links.belarusian: "Не", — круціць галавой. "Людзі не прымаюць наркотыкі, каб забіваць адно аднаго. Яны робяць гэта для таго, каб адчуваць сябе добра".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I thought officers in Revachol wou..."
links.english: "I thought officers in Revachol would be more enlightened about these things." She looks you in the eye. "Especially since you've admitted to taking drugs yourself."
links.polish: „Myślałam, że milicjanci w Revacholu są lepiej uświadomieni w tych kwestiach” – patrzy ci prosto w oczy. „Zwłaszcza że sam się pan przyznał do zażywania narkotyków”.
links.belarusian: "Я думала, што міліцыянты ў Рэвашолі лепш абазнаныя ў гэтых пытаннях," — глядзіць вам прама ў вочы. "Тым больш, што вы самі прызналіся ў ўжыванні наркотыкаў".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant gives you a sideways..."
links.english: The lieutenant gives you a sideways glance.
links.polish: Porucznik rzuca ci krótkie spojrzenie z ukosa.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант кідае на цябе кароткі касьпіць з-пад ілба позірк.

links.title: Rhetoric: "It's not one of respect. You may wa..."
links.english: It's not one of respect. You may want to add a clever *retort* to this one.
links.polish: Nie ma w nim szacunku. Może lepiej dodaj jakąś błyskotliwą *ripostę*.
links.belarusian: Ён не мае павагі. Магчыма, лепш дадай якую-небудзь вострую *рэпліку*.

links.title: You: ""I don't.""
links.english: "I don't."
links.polish: „Nie biorę ich”.
links.belarusian: "Я іх не бяру".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Of course." There's a pause. "I'm..."
links.english: "Of course." There's a pause. "I'm sorry. I withdraw my statement. I'm under stress here."
links.polish: „Oczywiście”. Kontynuuje po krótkiej pauzie: „Przepraszam, cofam to stwierdzenie. Jestem podminowana”.
links.belarusian: "Вядома". Працягвае пасля кароткай паўзы: "Прабачце, адклікаю гэтае сцвярджэнне. Я пад напружаннем".

links.title: You: ""Me and my drugs are none of your b..."
links.english: "Me and my drugs are none of your business."
links.polish: „Ja i moje narkotyki to nie pani sprawa”.
links.belarusian: "Я і мае наркотыкі — не ваша справа".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I'm sorry." There's a pause. "I wi..."
links.english: "I'm sorry." There's a pause. "I withdraw what I said -- I didn't mean to judge anyone."
